intro: Donia digyna, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often covered in fine hairs. Donia digyna is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
